metadata.title: Isomorphism on Groups
metadata.description: Two groups are isomorphic iff they are related via a bijection ϕ such that ϕ(ab) = ϕ(a)ϕ(b).

document.text:
Groups $G_1$ and $G_2$ are isomorphic ($G \cong H$) iff there is a bijection $\phi$ from $G_1$ to $G_2$ such that $\phi(ab) = \phi(a)\phi(b)$.
$\phi$ is called an isomorphism.
